@metadata.name: hash
@metadata.comment: The library is imported as default, and can be identified by prefix alone.

mw.ustring 003.description:
mw.ustring.byte( s, i[, j] )
 s - string used as source
 i - start index
 j - end index

mw.ustring 004.description:
mw.ustring.byteoffset( s[, l][, i] )
 s - string
 l - offset
 i - index

mw.ustring 005.description:
mw.ustring.char( ... )
 codepoints to be converted and concatenated

mw.ustring 006.description:
mw.ustring.codepoint( s, i[, j] )
 s - string used as source
 i - start index
 j - end index

mw.ustring 007.description:
mw.ustring.find( s, pattern[, init][, plain] )
 s - string used as source
 pattern - string to use while searching
 init - where to start searching
 plain - boolean to chose search method

mw.ustring 008.description:
mw.ustring.format( format, ... )
 format - string for the layout
 arguments for the format string

mw.ustring 009.description:
mw.ustring.gcodepoint( s, i[, j] )
 s - string used as source
 i - start index
 j - end index

mw.ustring 010.description:
mw.ustring.gmatch( s, pattern )
 s - string used as source
 pattern - string to use while searching

mw.ustring 011.description:
mw.ustring.gsub( s, pattern, repl[, n] )
 s - string used as source
 pattern - string to use while searching
 repl - string used as replacement
 n - number of copies

mw.ustring 012.description:
mw.ustring.isutf8( s )
 s - string used as source

mw.ustring 013.description:
mw.ustring.len( s )
 s - string used as source

mw.ustring 014.description:
mw.ustring.lower( s )
 s - string used as source

mw.ustring 015.description:
mw.ustring.match( s, pattern, init )
 s - string used as source
 pattern - string to use while searching
 init - where to start searching

mw.ustring 016.description:
mw.ustring.rep( s, n )
 s - string used as source
 n - number of copies

mw.ustring 017.description:
mw.ustring.sub( s, i[, j] )
 s - string used as source
 i - start index
 j - end index

mw.ustring 018.description:
mw.ustring.toNFC( s )
 s - string used as source

mw.ustring 019.description:
mw.ustring.toNFD( s )
 s - string used as source

mw.ustring 020.description:
mw.ustring.upper( s )
 s - string used as source
